meanings.definition: Discrimination or prejudice against individuals with disabilities.
meanings.sent1: She experienced ableism when she was not allowed to enter the building because of her wheelchair.
meanings.sent2: The community worked together to raise awareness about ableism and promote inclusivity.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character faced ableism from the other characters because of his different abilities.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the kingdom was divided by a wall of ableism, separating those with disabilities from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a creative activity to help the students understand the impact of ableism.

meanings.definition: The belief that able-bodied individuals are superior to those with disabilities.
meanings.sent1: His ableism made him think he was better than others just because of his physical abilities.
meanings.sent2: The conversation at the dinner table turned uncomfortable when someone expressed their ableism openly.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's archenemy was a villain fueled by ableism, thinking only the strongest deserved to exist.
meanings.sent4: The clouds of ableism obscured the true potential of the diverse group of individuals.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed a world where ableism was the norm, challenging viewers to reflect on their own biases.
